trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Zscaler One | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Zscaler One | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Zscaler One with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Zscaler One with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ZScaler One.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ZScaler One.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A ZScaler One single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A ZScaler One single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ZScaler One will be able to single sign into the application at your ZScaler One company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ZScaler One will be able to single sign into the application at your ZScaler One company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for ZScaler One
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for ZScaler One

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring proxy settings
trans-unit.target: Configuring proxy settings

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ZScaler One.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ZScaler One.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type ZScaler One.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type ZScaler One.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select ZScaler One, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select ZScaler One, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ZScaler One</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ZScaler One</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ZScaler One with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ZScaler One with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your ZScaler One tenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your ZScaler One tenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the ZScaler One application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the ZScaler One application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to ZScaler One page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to ZScaler One page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the ZScaler One Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your ZScaler One application, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the ZScaler One Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your ZScaler One application, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can get the actual value for your environment from your ZScaler One support team if you need it.
trans-unit.target: You can get the actual value for your environment from your ZScaler One support team if you need it.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at ZScaler One page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at ZScaler One page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your ZScaler One company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your ZScaler One company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Administration.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Administration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Under Manage Administrators & Roles, click Manage Users & Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Under Manage Administrators & Roles, click Manage Users & Authentication.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage Users & Authentication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage Users & Authentication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Choose Authentication Options for your Organization section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Choose Authentication Options for your Organization section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Authentication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Authentication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Authenticate using SAML Single Sign-On.
trans-unit.target: Select Authenticate using SAML Single Sign-On.

trans-unit.source: Click Configure SAML Single Sign-On Parameters.
trans-unit.target: Click Configure SAML Single Sign-On Parameters.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure SAML Single Sign-On Parameters dialog page, perform the following steps, and then click Done:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure SAML Single Sign-On Parameters dialog page, perform the following steps, and then click Done:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ZScaler One dialog page, copy the Authentication Request URL value, and then paste it into the URL of the SAML Portal to which users are sent for authentication textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ZScaler One dialog page, copy the Authentication Request URL value, and then paste it into the URL of the SAML Portal to which users are sent for authentication textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute containing Login Name textbox, type NameID.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute containing Login Name textbox, type NameID.

trans-unit.source: To upload your downloaded certificate, click Zscaler pem.
trans-unit.target: To upload your downloaded certificate, click Zscaler pem.

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SAML Auto-Provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SAML Auto-Provisioning.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure User Authentication dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure User Authentication dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: Click Activate Now.
trans-unit.target: Click Activate Now.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ZScaler One dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at ZScaler One dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Start Internet Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Start Internet Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Select Internet options from the Tools menu to open the Internet Options dialog.
trans-unit.target: Select Internet options from the Tools menu to open the Internet Options dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Internet Options</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Internet Options</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Connections tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Connections tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connections</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connections</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click LAN settings to open the LAN Settings dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click LAN settings to open the LAN Settings dialog.

trans-unit.source: In the Proxy server section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Proxy server section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Proxy server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Proxy server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Use a proxy server for your LAN.
trans-unit.target: Select Use a proxy server for your LAN.

trans-unit.source: In the Address textbox, type gateway.zscalerone.net.
trans-unit.target: In the Address textbox, type gateway.zscalerone.net.

trans-unit.source: In the Port textbox, type 80.
trans-unit.target: In the Port textbox, type 80.

trans-unit.source: Select Bypass proxy server for local addresses.
trans-unit.target: Select Bypass proxy server for local addresses.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Local Area Network (LAN) Settings dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to close the Local Area Network (LAN) Settings dialog.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Internet Options dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to close the Internet Options dialog.

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ZScaler One, they must be provisioned to ZScaler One.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ZScaler One, they must be provisioned to ZScaler One.

trans-unit.source: In the case of ZScaler One, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of ZScaler One, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Zscaler One tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Zscaler One tenant.

trans-unit.source: Click Administration.
trans-unit.target: Click Administration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click User Management.
trans-unit.target: Click User Management.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Users tab, click Add.
trans-unit.target: In the Users tab, click Add.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Add User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Add User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the UserID, User Display Name, Password, Confirm Password, and then select Groups and the Department of a valid AAD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: Type the UserID, User Display Name, Password, Confirm Password, and then select Groups and the Department of a valid AAD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other ZScaler One user account creation tools or APIs provided by ZScaler One to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other ZScaler One user account creation tools or APIs provided by ZScaler One to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the ZScaler One application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the ZScaler One application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
